Profile: Babita Panda. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: She joined KIIT Deemed to be University in the year 2012. Since then she has been serving here with a major in Electrical Engineering. She completed Ph.D. from KIIT Deemed to be University in the year 2017 with a good number of Publications in reputed Journals and conferences. Till date more than 90 nos. of publications were possible including Journal and Conferences. Apart from that, membership also attained in various Professional societies viz. IEEE, IET, IE(I) & ISLE. Her research interests include power electronics and drives, distributed generation, renewable energy, Standalone and grid connected Photovoltaic system. She has guided more than 80 B. Tech students, 20 M. Tech students,3 PhD students and presently 6 nos. of Ph. D. scholars are working under her supervision. SShe has completed 04 research projects funded by The Institute of Engineers (I) and BPUT (CRIS Scheme). She has also served as the Session Chair in IEEE and Elsevier conferences and Reviewer of many Journal and conferences.. Details: Email: babitapfel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57209093038, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?hl=en&user=uUMzE0UAAAAJ, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-3832-6570. Profile: Dr. Banishree Misra. Role: Associate Professor I. Bio: Dr. Banishree Misra is currently serving as an Associate Professor-I at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, where she has been a faculty member since 2008. She earned her Master’s degree in Power Electronics and Drives in 2007 and her Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering in 2018, both from KIIT. Dr. Misra has published over 35 research papers in reputed journals and conferences, including those by Elsevier, Springer, and IEEE. She is an active member of several professional societies, including IEEE, the Institution of Engineers (India) [IE(I)], the Indian Society of Lighting Engineers (ISLE), the Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE), and the Indian Science Congress Association (ISCA). Her research interests include power electronic converters, power quality improvement, design and analysis of active and passive filters, adaptive filter design, and grid synchronization techniques.. Details: Email: bmisrafel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/results/authorNamesList.uri?name=name&st1=Misra&st2=Banishree&origin=searchauthorlookup. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: Dr. Banishree Misra obtained her M.Tech in Power Electronics and Drives (2007) and Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering (2018) from Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (Deemed to be University) COURSE EXPERTISE: Electrical Machines, Power Electronics and Drives, Harmonic Elimination Techniques in Electrical Systems, Grid Integration and Control RESEARCH INTERESTS: Her research focuses on power quality enhancement, design and analysis of active and passive filters, adaptive filter designs, and grid synchronization techniques. Administrative Responsibilities: FIC Student Affairs & FIC Electric Drives Laboratory Professional Membership: IEEE, IE (India), ISTE, ISLE, ISCA

Profile: Chinmoy Kumar Panigrahi. Role: Professor and Director, School of Electrical Engineering, Director, Co-Branded Program. Bio: Prof. Chinmoy Kumar Panigrahi is currently the Professor and Director of the School of Electrical Engineering at KIIT DU. His research focuses on Soft Computing Techniques, Power Systems, Renewable Energy, Battery Management Systems, Deregulation, and Smart Grids. He has supervised 30 PhD scholars and 72 M.Tech scholars, with four ongoing PhD candidates under his joint guidance. Prof. Panigrahi has published 182 research articles in referred journals and presented 148 papers at reputed conferences. He previously served as Reader and HOD at BIT Mesra (2006–2009) and HOD at BIET Bhadrak (1991–2006). Over his 34-year academic career, he has received multiple accolades, including the Top 3 Ph.D. Supervisor at KIIT in 2022 and Outstanding Scientist Award (2020). He is a senior IEEE member and holds fellowships with various prestigious organizations.. Details: Email: chinmoy.panigrahifel@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?view_op=list_works&hl=en&hl=en&user=eYHa9_sAAAAJ&pagesize=100, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1203-9565. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: Earned B.Sc (Engg.) in Electrical Engineering from Sambalpur University (1990), M.E from VSSUT University (1998), Ph.D. from Jadavpur University (2007). COURSE EXPERTISE: BEE, Electrical Machines, Power System Restructuring, Smart Grid and Research Methodology RESEARCH INTERESTS: Soft Computing Techniques, Power Systems, Renewable Energy, Battery Management System, Deregulation and Smart Grid Administrative Responsibilities: Chair, EV Task Force, Professor and Director, School of Electrical Engineering, Director, Co-Branded Program Awards and Achievements: Senior Grade (Five years), Awarded by Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE), 2025

Profile: Deepak Kumar Gupta. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Deepak Kumar Gupta received B.Tech. degree in Electrical Engineering from BBDNITM Lucknow in 2011 and M. Tech. in Power Systems from NIT Hamirpur H.P. in 2013. He completed his Ph.D from IIT (BHU), Varanasi in 2018. He is currently working as an Assistant Professor in School of Electrical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University. His current research interests include control of Power Systems, FACTS devices, Load Frequency Control and optimization techniques and photovoltaic systems.. Details: Email: deepak.guptafel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57211009339, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=eKqvrgsAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0994-9282. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: Ph.D. from IIT (BHU) Varanasi COURSE EXPERTISE: Power Systems RESEARCH INTERESTS: Intelligent Power Flow Control Administrative Responsibilities: FIC, Examination Cell, School of Electrical Engineering

Profile: Geetanjali Dei. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: GEETANJALI DEI received her B.E. Degree from Department of Electrical Engineering, University College of Engineering, Burla, Odisha. She obtained her M. Tech degree in Power System Engineering from V.S.S.U.T, Burla in 2010. She is working as Assistant Professor in Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Orissa. She is currently perusing her Ph.D. in automatic generation control in deregulated environment. Her research areas of interest are soft computing, power system operation & control and automatic generation control.. Details: Email: geetanjali.deifel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57214236327, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=U9OtT6IAAAAJ&hl=en&authuser=1&oi=ao, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5672-2860. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: continuing PhD COURSE EXPERTISE: Control System, Power System, Network Theory RESEARCH INTERESTS: Load Frequency Control in deregulated System .soft computing Administrative Responsibilities: Project Co-ordinator Professional Membership: ISTE,IEEE

Profile: Dr. K.V.V.S.R.Chowdary. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. V. V. S. R. Chowdary Kantipudi holds a B.Tech in Electrical and Electronics Engineering from JNTU Hyderabad and an M.Tech and Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from KIIT Deemed to be University. He began his career as a Maintenance Engineer at Hindustan Motors Ltd., Kolkata, working in the Accu Forge maintenance division. He is currently an Assistant Professor in the School of Electrical Engineering at KIIT, Bhubaneswar. His research focuses on wireless charging of electric vehicles, power converters, and FEA analysis of charging coils. He has coordinated major academic and administrative responsibilities, including SAP Timetable, Examinations, Smart EV Minor Course, EV Task Force, and L&T EduTech EV Specialization. He teaches electric vehicles, power converters, and electrical drives. He also contributes to outreach programs and serves as a reviewer for reputed journals.. Details: Email: rchowdaryfel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?origin=resultslist&authorId=56267782100&zone=, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=mYr2420AAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2682-8781. M.Tech, Power Electronics & Drives, KIIT Deemed to be university, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India, 2011. B. Tech, Electrical & Electronics Engg., J.N.T.U Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, India, 2008. Profile: Dr. Lipika Nanda. Role: Associate professor(I). Bio: She is an Associate Professor (I) at the School of Electrical Engineering, KIIT University (Institute of Eminence), with a Ph.D. in Hardware Realization of Multilevel Inverters (2019). Her research areas include Power Electronics, Electrical Drives, Solar Photovoltaics, and Renewable Energy. Since joining KIIT in 2007, she has guided 20 M.Tech and numerous B.Tech projects and published extensively in reputed journals and conferences. A life member of IET, ISTE, ISLE, ISCA, and IEEE, she has received awards such as the Innovative Researcher and Dedicated Best Academician Award (2020), Women Researcher Award (2020), Global Women Achievers (2021), and Young Scientist Award (2022). She holds seven patents, four book chapters, and serves as an Editorial Board Member and Educational Consultant for promoting academic excellence.. Details: Email: lnandafel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57193767786, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?view_op=new_articles&hl=en&imq=Lipika+Nanda#, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8176-8625. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: PhD COURSE EXPERTISE: Power Electronics, Electrical Drives, Basic Instrumentation and Basic Electrical Engineering RESEARCH INTERESTS: Solar interfaced Power converters, Electric Drive applications Administrative Responsibilities: KIITX convener, Disciplinary committee member(School level),Semester coordinator(1st year),Coursera coordinator(University level) and FIC(BEE lab) Awards and Achievements: “Global Women Achievers 2021” by GLOBAL TRIUMPH FOUNDATION on 16th October 2021

Profile: Lipsa Subhadarshini. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Prof. Lipsa Subhadarshini holds B.Tech and M.Tech degrees in Electrical Engineering with a specialization in Electronic Systems and Communication from NIT Rourkela. With over 7 years of academic experience, she serves as an Assistant Professor at the KIIT School of Electrical Engineering. Her expertise includes electronic devices, communication systems, and signal processing. She teaches courses such as Principles of Communication Engineering, Analog and Digital Electronics, and Wireless Network Systems. Prof. Subhadarshini is the Faculty-in-Charge of the Global Immersion Program and School Branding. She holds one patent and has published several papers, articles, and book chapters in national and international journals and conferences. Dedicated to academic excellence, she actively contributes to curriculum development, student mentoring, and continuous professional growth.. Details: Email: lipsa.subhadarshinifel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=59012478200, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=uBHgWmwAAAAJ, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4146-738X. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: B. Tech and M. Tech from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela in the field of Electrical Engineering with specialization in Electronics System and Communication COURSE EXPERTISE: Analog Electronics, Digital Electronics, Principles of Communication Engineering, Basic Electrical Engineering, Digital System Design using FPGA, Wireless Network Systems, Scientific and Technical Writing RESEARCH INTERESTS: Signal Processing, Smart Antenna System, Mobile Communication, Wireless Communication Administrative Responsibilities: FIC, Branding, FIC Global Immersion Program Patents and Innovations: 1 Patent

Profile: Manoj Kumar Maharana. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: After completion of M.Tech from NIT Warangal, Dr. Manoj joined GECE Ltd. Hyderabad and served there for 1 year. After that shifted to JITS Karmnagar, VIT Vellore, went to pursued PhD from IIT Madar, and join to KIIT as an Associate Professor in the year 2011. Since then he has been serving here with a major in Electrical Engineering. He has published papers in the Springer, Elsevier, Wiley Journals. Till date more than 30 nos. of publications were possible including Journal and Conferences. Apart from that, membership also attained in various Professional societies viz. IEEE, IET, SSI is an added feature to his career. His research interest includes Load frequency control in Microgrid, High impedance fault identification and islanding detection in power system. Details: Email: mkmfel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=26422413700, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=CVGSy-AAAAAJ, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6196-5856. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: PhD (IIT Madras) COURSE EXPERTISE: Power System Operation and Control, Computer Aided Power System RESEARCH INTERESTS: Load frequency Control, High Impedance fault identification and islanding detection in microgrid Administrative Responsibilities: Chairmain Project Monitoring comitee, Course coordinator of University (UHV, Research Methodology, Element of Machine Learning) Coordinator Learns from Pers Program, Convenor BoS of School of Electrical Enineering. Awards and Achievements: Corps of Electrical and Mechanical Engineers’ Prize 2010-2011
Manoj K Maharana, K S Swarup, “Direct Acyclic Graph Based Corrective Control Strategies for Alleviation of Line Overloads during Contingencies “Journal of The Institute of Engineers (India), December 16, 2011 Professional Membership: IET, IE (India), SSI(Life member)

Profile: Dr. Padarbinda Samal. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Padarbinda Samal received his B.Tech. from S.I.T., Bhubaneswar in 2009, M.Tech. in Power System Engineering from V.S.S. University of Technology, Burla in 2013, and Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from NIT Rourkela in 2018. He served as Assistant Professor at I.T.E.R., SOA University from 2010 to 2011 and has been with KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar since 2017. His research interests include distribution system planning and soft computing applications in power systems. He has published over 50 research articles in reputed journals and conferences, six Indian patents, reviewed numerous scientific papers, and serves on the editorial boards of several journals.. Details: Email: padarbinda.samalfel@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57092562300, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=98hEvvUAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4811-8150. Profile: Dr. Pradeep Kumar Sahu. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Prof. Pradeep Kumar Sahu, Associate Professor at the School of Electrical Sciences, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, has over 21 years of teaching and research experience. He earned his Ph.D. from NIT Rourkela in 2016, specializing in Solar PV Systems, Non-linear Control, and Advanced Power Electronics Converters, and completed post-doctoral research at KIIT (2006–2008). He has guided 18 M.Tech and 5 Ph.D. scholars, published over 45 research papers with 300+ citations, and received the Best Quality Research Paper Award at INDICON-2013, IIT Kharagpur. Prof. Sahu holds memberships in IEEE (USA) and IET (UK). His research interests include grid-connected PV systems, electric vehicles, and power quality. He also leads government-sponsored skill development programs such as Skill India, Suryamitra, and NISE, promoting clean energy education and training initiatives.. Profile: Dr. Rudra Narayan Dash. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Rudra Narayan Dash is an Assistant Professor II, Assistant Controller of Examination, and FIC SA at the School of Electrical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He joined KIIT in 2011 and has held key administrative roles, including FIC Examination (2012–2014), FIC QA (2014–2019), and Program Head B.Tech (2020–2024). Under his tenure, the school achieved multiple accreditations such as IET, ABET, and NAAC. He earned his Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from KIIT (2018), M.Tech from NIT Rourkela (2010), and B.Tech from KIIT (2005). With over 16 years of teaching experience, he has published 48+ research papers and currently guides three Ph.D. scholars. A member of IEEE, IET, ISTE, and IE (India), his research interests include soft computing, power systems, fault diagnosis, and evolutionary algorithms.. Profile: Dr. Sanhita Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor.
